title: DSC 209 Project 1 Final Submission
description: This visualization was created from the grocery db csv file that can be found here: https://dsc-courses.github.io/dsc209r-2025-fa/projects/project1/#data-grocery-store-foods. This histogram was used to visualize organic products at Whole Foods by their food processing score

title: DSC 209 Project 2 Proposition
description: This visualization was created from the Civilian Complaints Against New York City Police Officers dataset, which can be found here https://dsc-courses.github.io/dsc209r-2025-fa/projects/project2/#datasets. This line graph showcases that neighborhood policing in New York resulting in an increase in complaints filed

title: DSC 209 Project 2 2015 Neighborhood Policing Bar Plot
description: This visualization was created from the Civilian Complaints Against New York City Police Officers dataset, which can be found here https://dsc-courses.github.io/dsc209r-2025-fa/projects/project2/#datasets. This barplot indicates that the implementation in neighborhood policing in 2015 increased the number of complaints filed.

title: DSC 209 Project 2 Barplot with Number of Complaints filed for excessive force by ethnicity group
description: This visualization was created from the Civilian Complaints Against New York City Police Officers dataset, which can be found here https://dsc-courses.github.io/dsc209r-2025-fa/projects/project2/#datasets. I created this barplot to visualize the effect of neighborhood policing on reducing complaints filed for excessive force by New York Citizens categorized by their ethnicity.

title: DSC 207 Mini Project Boxplot of Happiness by Country
description: For my DSC 207 Python course, I was tasked with analyzing happiness scores by country, which can be found here https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/bhanupratapbiswas/world-happiness-2016. This boxplot visualizes the distribution of life expectancy for region that is referenced in the dataset.

title: DSC 207 Final Project KMeans of NBA field goals data
description: For my DSC 207 Python course, I decided to analyze data for NBA Field Goals attempted between the 2004 and 2022 seasons. This visualization represents a KMeans Clustering Analysis that I performed to categorize groups of players by the amount of field goals attempted and field goal percentage.

title: DSC 232 Group Project for Spotify Data
description: For my DSC 232 Big Data course, I analyzed spotify data. In this instance, I created a KMeans cluster to group a songs popularity (0 to 100) against its dancability (0 to 1)

title: Video Games Sales Simple Linear Regression of NA and Global Sales
description: I worked on a side project by analzying the following dataset https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/gregorut/videogamesales. I performed a linear regression model and learned that the correlation between the North American Sales for a video game as well the global sales for a video games is 85.0%

title: Lamar Jackson Passing Completions and Passing Yards Cluster (2018 to 2022)
description: I worked on a side project by analzying the passing statistics of football quarterback Lamar Jackson. I performed a KMeans cluster analysis and categorized the performance of Lamar Jackson in terms of completions and passing yards into three distinct clusters

title: Distribution of Shopping Sales By Season
description: This pie chart depicts the sales of fashion items as depicted in this dataset: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/iamsouravbanerjee/customer-shopping-trends-dataset. I create this pie chart to display the visualization of total sales by season.

title: Countplot of Position Players Who Played for the Colorado Rockies By Position
description: This barplot was generated from a dataset about position players who played for the Colorado Rockies MLB franchise. This shows that the majority of position players who have played for the rockies are catchers.

title: Scatterplot of Earned Runs Allowed Allowed and Earned Run Average for Pitchers who played for the Colorado Rockies
description: This scatterplot visualizes the performance of Colorado Rockies pitchers by the number of earned runs allowed on the x axis and the earned run average on the y axis.
